jobs.title: Marketing Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Double the Donation was founded in 2011 and specializes in cloud-based software focused exclusively on the fundraising needs of nonprofit organizations and educational institutions. We've grown to be the leading provider of fundraising software that helps nonprofits and schools increase revenue through corporate matching gift and employee volunteer grant programs.

Thousands of the largest nonprofits in the world like the American Heart Association, Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, Save the Children, Boys and Girls Club of America, as well as hundreds of the top educational institutions like Emory, UGA, Vanderbilt, Case Western, and University of Virginia rely on our services to effectively grow their employee matching gift program revenue.

As a growing company, every employee plays a huge part in our success!

Role Overview

We are seeking a results-oriented Marketing Specialist to own strategy, execution, and optimization of all email outreach across the prospect and customer lifecycle.

Responsibilities

  • This role requires a versatile marketer who is strategic, hands-on, and thrives in a fast-moving environment. If you’re the kind of person who loves both the strategic and execution side of marketing campaigns, then this role may be a good fit for you.

  • Manage all marketing channels including email, SEO, content marketing, events, website, and social media, ensuring each channel is optimized for performance and aligned with revenue goals.

  • Develop and execute full-funnel campaigns to drive lead generation, pipeline acceleration, customer acquisition, and retention, in collaboration with sales and product teams

  • Create and manage a high-impact content strategy (e.g., blogs, case studies, whitepapers, landing pages, slide decks, email nurtures) that bolster conversion

  • Lead marketing operations and automation, including campaign setup, lead scoring, segmentation, and nurture programs through tools like HubSpot and Customer.io.

  • Oversee the web visibility as a core growth asset: ensure the site is optimized for performance, user experience, GEO, and conversion

  • Align closely with sales and revenue teams to ensure tight integration between marketing and pipeline generation; provide enablement materials, sales collateral, and feedback loops

  • Identify new growth opportunities, emerging channels, and strategic partnerships to expand reach and drive top-line growth

Requirements

  • 5-10 years of marketing experience

  • Demonstrated success through academic and career background

  • Knowledge of marketing across channels: email outreach, LinkedIn, GEO and more

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Skills

  • Experience marketing to nonprofits or in SaaS fundraising tech.

  • Proficiency with Hubspot as a marketing-automation platforms

Benefits

Compensation Details:

  • Hourly compensation is in USD

  • Starting salary: ₱100,000/month, with increases based on experience and performance

  • Competitive pay reflecting your skills and background

  • In addition to base salary, we provide a company contribution to help cover health insurance and other self-selected benefits

  • Target of 42.5 billable hours per week

  • You’ll also accrue Life Leave, which can be cashed out annually as additional income

Meet the Team
We currently have 40+ team members who live in the Philippines who have been fantastic team members and we’re excited to add new team members to this new role! Meet our PH Team Members

Hiring Process
Our hiring process is intentionally tough and time-consuming because this is a competitive role with competitive compensation. Select candidates will be invited to complete a one-way video interview and an initial screening interview. Once you pass the initial screening, a number of online assessments testing your critical thinking and English skills will be sent. Select candidates will be invited to an hour-long Zoom interview with the President of the company.

Other Requirements

Location
This is a work-from-home setup.

Work Schedule

This role follows a consistent daily rhythm that aligns with US Eastern business hours while giving you time for rest, personal tasks, and balance throughout your day.

Here’s what a typical day looks like:

  • Start your day with a 4.5-hour work block: 9:30am–2:00pm (PHT)

  • Enjoy your afternoon free: 2:00pm–8:00pm (PHT)

  • Finish your workday with another 4.5-hour block: 8:00pm–12:30am (PHT)

  • Sleep/rest: 12:30am–9:30am (PHT)

This structure offers a long midday break while supporting strong collaboration with US-based teams during their business hours.

What Your Typical Day May Look Like

Note: All of these times would shift 1 hour later when the time difference switches to 13 hour differences from 12 hour differences

Benefits

Paid vacation time

  • 20 days accrued annually

  • These paid days off each equate to 8.0 hours of billable time.

  • Expect to use 5 of the days during the Christmas – New Year’s period.

Paid sick time

  • 5 sick days off annually

Paid life leave*

  • 15 days accrued annually.

  • Once per year in December, you can cash out any accrued life leave time. Every 5 days your cash out is worth about $300.

*Life Leave allows team members to use their holidays as it’s meant to be – a break – whilst knowing they’ve got the breathing space to tap into extra leave for the planned and unplanned life moments.

Paid holidays

  • You have 7 paid US holidays.

Additional benefits

  • Bereavement Policy

  • Employee Giving Programs (Matching Gift Program, Volunteer Grant Program, etc)

jobs.title: Software Engineer / Software Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Double the Donation was founded in 2011 and specializes in cloud-based software focused exclusively on the fundraising needs of nonprofit organizations and educational institutions. We've grown to be the leading provider of fundraising software that helps nonprofits and schools increase revenue through corporate matching gift and employee volunteer grant programs.

Thousands of the largest nonprofits in the world like the American Heart Association, Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, Save the Children, Boys and Girls Club of America, as well as hundreds of the top educational institutions like Emory, UGA, Vanderbilt, Case Western, and University of Virginia rely on our services to effectively grow their employee matching gift program revenue.

As a growing company, every employee plays a huge part in our success!

We are looking to hire individuals based in the Philippines to help us better serve our clients from the nonprofit and mission-driven space.

As a Tech Team Developer, you will be:

  • Implementing features in our core application

  • Researching bug requests and quickly resolving issues

  • Participating in our bi-weekly sprint planning

  • Handling advanced troubleshooting on the tech support side when our Client Success and Support teams need assistance for clients

With 50+ Filipino team members already thriving in our company, we are excited to expand this growing team with new talent!

If you’re in the Philippines, have a knack software development, and are eager to drive growth for nonprofits, we'd love to hear from you. Join us and be a part of a team where your contributions have a lasting impact.

In this role, you will:

  • Provide technical support on the side

  • Help clean, maintain, and document clojure code

  • Collaborate with our tech team identify, define, and implement software features

  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving code quality

  • Troubleshoot and debug complex technical issues

  • Help build and maintain a robust testing infrastructure

  • Contribute to the overall technical direction of the product

  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, etc.)

  • Experience with DevOps practices and tools (CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation)

  • Experience with data analysis libraries

  • DevOps Support

  • Deployment to Production

Our Codebase:

Our core application is built in Clojure. Experience with Clojure or a Functional Programming Language is a nice-to-have, but not necessary to start.

  • There are some features / parts of our application where individuals can contribute on Day 1 without Clojure knowledge.

  • We expect team members to grow their Clojure skills rapidly, and part of your long-term compensation is based on becoming a strong contributing team member across our full codebase.

Additional Tech Stack Details:

  • Our systems run on Microsoft Azure Cloud computing platform.

  • Postgres is our primary data store.

  • Elasticsearch powers our search experience.

  • We utilize Azure Blob storage for file uploads and miscellaneous object storage.

  • We leverage Github Actions for CI/CD process automation.

  • We use Capistrano for deployment orchestration.

  • We rely on Sendgrid for email delivery.

  • Our app is a Single-page web application (SPA) built atop React.

  • Bootstrap for CSS for styling

  • We use Playwright for end-to-end testing and browser automation.

  • Datadog for monitoring and observability

  • Zoho (crucially: not Jira!) for issue tracking

Wages

  • Hourly compensation is in $USD.

  • We offer a competitive salary range with the exact amount reflecting your experience and skills

  • Aside from the base salary, there will also be an additional company contribution to go towards health insurance and additional benefits that you buy on your own

  • Target 42.5 billable hours per week

  • Additionally, you accrue Life Leave which can optionally be cashed in each year adding to your earnings

Meet the Team

  • We currently have 50+ team members who live in the Philippines who have been fantastic team members and we’re excited to add new team members to this new role! Meet our PH Team Members.

  • You'll be working with our product, tech, and design teams that are split between the US & Philippines.

Work Schedule

This role follows a consistent daily rhythm that aligns with US Eastern business hours while giving you time for rest, personal tasks, and balance throughout your day.

Here’s what a typical day looks like:

  • Start your day with a 4.5-hour work block: 9:30am–2:00pm (PHT)

  • Enjoy your afternoon free: 2:00pm–8:00pm (PHT)

  • Finish your workday with another 4.5-hour block: 8:00pm–12:30am (PHT)

  • Sleep/rest: 12:30am–9:30am (PHT)

This structure offers a long midday break while supporting strong collaboration with US-based teams during their business hours.

What Your Typical Day May Look Like

Note: All of these times would shift 1 hour later when the time difference switches to 13 hour differences from 12 hour differences

What Makes a Strong Candidate

  • Based in the Philippines with consistent availability for a long-term role.

  • Consistent availability and looking for a long-term position

  • Highly organized and outstanding organizational ability

  • Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong academic background from someone who graduated with an outstanding General Weighted Average (often honors graduates) from one of the Big 4 universities in the Philippines (UP, Ateneo, DLSU, or UST)

  • Individuals who graduate with a major in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, and other related fields

  • Solid understanding of functional programming concepts

  • Experience with web development frameworks

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills

As a small growing business, there are a few traits unique to our business that individuals should consider before applying.

  • You must love the idea of giving back to the community and nonprofits. There are thousands of jobs. If being involved in the success of nonprofits is something you’re truly passionate about, this could be a great role.

  • You must be extremely comfortable with change. As a small growing company, decisions can be made over a weekend and fully implemented by early the next week. Whether that’s new systems, new processes, or new approaches, we look for individuals who can adapt and thrive.

  • You must believe that the best contributors should get better rewards. As a company, we believe in paying people based on the value they generate at the business.

  • You must be willing to disagree and commit. As a growing business, there will be lots of decisions that get made and changes that occur during your time at the company. Some of which you’ll agree with and some you won’t, we strongly believe that the best team members have the ability to disagree and commit (i.e., going with a decision after it has been made regardless of whether or not you agree).

  • You must believe the status quo is unacceptable. As a growing company and as individuals, we believe the status quo is unacceptable. Everyone should be relentless in striving to be the best version of themselves and figure out ways to create more value at the company, enhance our client's results, and grow professionally. The question should always be “How can I be better” rather than “How can expectations be adjusted”.

We also need you to:

  • Be able to work independently and have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment

  • Have excellent written & verbal communication skills

  • Have a demonstrated ability to learn new things quickly and think on your feet

  • Can work through obstacles and challenges

  • Be highly organized with strong time management skills

  • Be results driven and goal-oriented

Benefits

Paid vacation time

  • 20 days accrued annually

  • These paid days off each equate to 8.0 hours of billable time.

  • Expect to use 5 of the days during the Christmas – New Year’s period.

Paid sick time

  • 5 sick days off annually

Paid life leave*

  • 15 days accrued annually.

  • Once per year, you can cash out any accrued life leave time. Every 5 days you cash out is worth about $600.

*Life Leave allows team members to use their holidays as it’s meant to be – a break – whilst knowing they’ve got the breathing space to tap into extra leave for the planned and unplanned life moments.

Paid holidays

  • You have 7 paid US holidays.

Additional benefits

  • Bereavement Policy

  • Employee Giving Programs (Matching Gift Program, Volunteer Grant Program, etc)

As a growing company, every employee plays a huge part in our success!

We are seeking a highly creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer to join our marketing team. This role is responsible for creating visual content that communicates our brand, supports our marketing and sales initiatives, and helps nonprofits better understand the value of our tools. From website graphics and social media content to product illustrations and sales collateral, your designs will play a key role in enhancing our brand presence and supporting our mission.

Key Responsibilities:

Visual Content Creation

  • Design compelling visuals for digital and print including website graphics, email campaigns, social media posts, landing pages, one-pagers, and more

  • Develop visual content that supports educational materials such as blog illustrations, infographics, and product guides.

  • Translate complex software features and nonprofit concepts into clean, accessible graphics.

Brand Consistency

  • Ensure brand consistency across all visual assets by following established design guidelines.

  • Collaborate with marketing, sales, and product teams to maintain a unified visual identity across departments and campaigns.

Marketing & Campaign Support

  • Work closely with the marketing team to create visual assets for product launches, webinars, lead generation campaigns, and email marketing efforts.

  • Design visuals that help drive engagement, conversions, and brand recognition.

Product Graphics

  • Support the product marketing and customer success teams by creating software graphics, tutorial visuals, and presentation decks that showcase product features.

  • Assist in visual storytelling to highlight user benefits and software usability.

Design Project Management

  • Manage multiple design projects simultaneously and deliver high-quality assets on tight deadlines.

  • Receive and implement feedback from team members to ensure final designs meet objectives.

A Typical Day in the Role

While each day may vary, here are some examples of tasks you can expect to work on in this role:

  • Create branded graphics for an upcoming webinar, including presentation slides, promotional emails, and social media teasers.

  • Collaborate with the content team to design an infographic explaining how matching gifts work for educational institutions.

  • Update an existing product brochure to reflect recent feature updates and ensure alignment with updated brand elements.

  • Design a set of icons to visually differentiate features within our fundraising platform.

  • Join a meeting with the marketing team to brainstorm design strategies for an upcoming client education campaign.

     Required Skills and Experience

  • Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in digital design, branding, and visual storytelling.

  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (especially Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign) or other equivalent professional design tools.

  • Excellent understanding of visual hierarchy, layout, typography, and user-centered design.

  • Ability to manage multiple design projects and meet deadlines consistently.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience designing for SaaS, tech, or nonprofit-focused companies.

  • Basic understanding of HTML/CSS and web design principles.

  • Familiarity with video editing and motion graphics tools is a plus.

Personal Attributes

  • High attention to detail and strong visual communication skills.

  • Open to feedback and able to revise work based on team input.

  • Creative thinker with the ability to turn abstract ideas into compelling visuals.

  • Strong sense of initiative and proactive problem-solving skills.

  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work independently.

Double the Donation was founded in 2011 and specializes in cloud-based software focused exclusively on the fundraising needs of nonprofit organizations and educational institutions. We've grown to be the leading provider of fundraising software that helps nonprofits and schools increase revenue through corporate matching gift and employee volunteer grant programs.

Thousands of the largest nonprofits in the world like the American Heart Association, Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, Save the Children, Boys and Girls Club of America, as well as hundreds of the top educational institutions like Emory, UGA, Vanderbilt, Case Western, and University of Virginia rely on our services to effectively grow their employee matching gift program revenue.

As a growing company, every employee plays a huge part in our success!

We are seeking a highly creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer to join our marketing team. This role is responsible for creating visual content that communicates our brand, supports our marketing and sales initiatives, and helps nonprofits better understand the value of our tools. From website graphics and social media content to product illustrations and sales collateral, your designs will play a key role in enhancing our brand presence and supporting our mission.

Key Responsibilities:

Visual Content Creation

 - Design compelling visuals for digital and print including website graphics, email campaigns, social media posts, landing pages, one-pagers, and more

 - Develop visual content that supports educational materials such as blog illustrations, infographics, and product guides.

 - Translate complex software features and nonprofit concepts into clean, accessible graphics.
   

Brand Consistency

 - Ensure brand consistency across all visual assets by following established design guidelines.

 - Collaborate with marketing, sales, and product teams to maintain a unified visual identity across departments and campaigns.
   

Marketing & Campaign Support

 - Work closely with the marketing team to create visual assets for product launches, webinars, lead generation campaigns, and email marketing efforts.

 - Design visuals that help drive engagement, conversions, and brand recognition.
   

Product Graphics

 - Support the product marketing and customer success teams by creating software graphics, tutorial visuals, and presentation decks that showcase product features.

 - Assist in visual storytelling to highlight user benefits and software usability.
   

Design Project Management

 - Manage multiple design projects simultaneously and deliver high-quality assets on tight deadlines.

 - Receive and implement feedback from team members to ensure final designs meet objectives.
   

A Typical Day in the Role

While each day may vary, here are some examples of tasks you can expect to work on in this role:

 - Create branded graphics for an upcoming webinar, including presentation slides, promotional emails, and social media teasers.

 - Collaborate with the content team to design an infographic explaining how matching gifts work for educational institutions.

 - Update an existing product brochure to reflect recent feature updates and ensure alignment with updated brand elements.

 - Design a set of icons to visually differentiate features within our fundraising platform.

 - Join a meeting with the marketing team to brainstorm design strategies for an upcoming client education campaign.
   
   Required Skills and Experience

 - Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in digital design, branding, and visual storytelling.

 - Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (especially Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign) or other equivalent professional design tools.

 - Excellent understanding of visual hierarchy, layout, typography, and user-centered design.

 - Ability to manage multiple design projects and meet deadlines consistently.
   

Preferred Skills

 - Experience designing for SaaS, tech, or nonprofit-focused companies.

 - Basic understanding of HTML/CSS and web design principles.

 - Familiarity with video editing and motion graphics tools is a plus.
   

Personal Attributes

 - High attention to detail and strong visual communication skills.

 - Open to feedback and able to revise work based on team input.

 - Creative thinker with the ability to turn abstract ideas into compelling visuals.

 - Strong sense of initiative and proactive problem-solving skills.

 - Collaborative mindset with the ability to work independently.

Wages
Hourly compensation is in $USD

We offer a competitive salary reflecting experience and skills

Aside from the base salary, there will also be an additional company contribution to go towards health insurance and additional benefits that you buy on your own

Target 42.5 billable hours per week

We currently have 40+ team members who live in the Philippines who have been fantastic team members and we’re excited to add new team members to this new role! Meet our PH Team Members

Our hiring process is intentionally tough and time-consuming because this is a competitive role with competitive compensation. Select candidates will be invited to complete a one-way video interview and an initial screening interview. Once you pass the initial screening, a number of online assessments testing your critical thinking and English skills will be sent. Select candidates will be invited to an hour-long Zoom interview with the President of the company.

This is a work-from-home setup.

Work Schedule

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Double the Donation was founded in 2011 and specializes in cloud-based software focused exclusively on the fundraising needs of nonprofit organizations and educational institutions. We've grown to be the leading provider of fundraising software that helps nonprofits and schools increase revenue through corporate matching gift and employee volunteer grant programs.

Thousands of the largest nonprofits in the world like the American Heart Association, Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, Save the Children, Boys and Girls Club of America, as well as hundreds of the top educational institutions like Emory, UGA, Vanderbilt, Case Western, and University of Virginia rely on our services to effectively grow their employee matching gift program revenue.

As a growing company, every employee plays a huge part in our success!

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge marketing projects with a dynamic team and, for top performers with competitive pay that starts at P100K per month.

Events & Webinars

📌 Digital & In-Person Event Management

  • Plan, market, and execute virtual events & webinars

  • Create trade show and event marketing materials

📌 Digital Events / Webinar / Operations Support

  • Provide logistics and marketing execution for events

What We Offer

✅ Flexible, remote work on an as-needed basis
✅ Competitive hourly rates
✅ Collaboration with a talented, global marketing team
✅ Exciting projects with innovative brands and platforms

Who You Are

✔ Experienced freelancer with 2+ years in your area of expertise
✔ Proactive, reliable, and detail-oriented
✔ Passionate about marketing, technology, and data-driven results
✔ Open to long-term collaboration and potential full-time work

How to Apply

If you specialize in one or more of these areas and want to be part of a high-growth agency, we’d love to connect.

Let’s build something great together! 🚀

Wages

  • Hourly compensation is in $USD

  • We offer a competitive salary reflecting experience and skills

  • Aside from the base salary, there will also be an additional company contribution to go towards health insurance and additional benefits that you buy on your own

  • Target 42.5 billable hours per week

  • Additionally, you accrue Life Leave which can optionally be cashed in each year adding to your earnings

Meet the Team

We currently have 50+ team members who live in the Philippines who have been fantastic team members and we’re excited to add new team members to this new role!  Meet our PH Team Members

​Other Requirements

Location

  • This is a work-from-home setup. 

  • You would work a night shift (approximately 8am-5pm EST)​

What Makes a Strong Candidate

  • Based in the Philippines with consistent availability for a long-term role.

  • Highly organized and outstanding organizational ability

  • A team player who has a willingness to learn and grow at a fast-pace

  • Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong academic background who graduated with an outstanding General Weighted Average

  • Individuals who graduate with a major that could be a good fit including Communications, Business Ad, Public Relations, Journalism, English, Public Administration, or other Liberal Arts and Business degrees

As a small growing business, there are a few traits unique to our business that individuals should consider before applying.

  • You must love the idea of giving back to the community and nonprofits. There are thousands of jobs. If being involved in the success of nonprofits is something you’re truly passionate about, this could be a great role.

  • You must be extremely comfortable with change. As a small growing company, decisions can be made over a weekend and fully implemented by early the next week. Whether that’s new systems, new processes, or new approaches, we look for individuals who can adapt and thrive.

  • You must believe that the best contributors should get better rewards. As a company, we believe in paying people based on the value they generate at the business.

  • You must be willing to disagree and commit. As a growing business, there will be lots of decisions that get made and changes that occur during your time at the company. Some of which you’ll agree with and some you won’t, we strongly believe that the best team members have the ability to disagree and commit (i.e., going with a decision after it has been made regardless of whether or not you agree).

  • You must believe the status quo is unacceptable. As a growing company and as individuals, we believe the status quo is unacceptable. Everyone should be relentless in striving to be the best version of themselves and figure out ways to create more value at the company, enhance our client's results, and grow professionally. The question should always be “How can I be better” rather than “How can expectations be adjusted”.

We also need you to:

  • Be able to work independently and have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment

  • Have excellent written & verbal communication skills

  • Have a demonstrated ability to learn new things quickly and think on your feet

  • Can work through obstacles and challenges

  • Be highly organized with strong time management skills

  • Be results driven and goal-oriented

Benefits

Paid vacation time

  • 20 days accrued annually

  • These paid days off each equate to 8.0 hours of billable time.

  • Expect to use 5 of the days during the Christmas – New Year’s period.

Paid sick time

  • 5 sick days off annually

Paid life leave*

  • 15 days accrued annually.

  • Once per year in December, you can cash out any accrued life leave time. Every 5 days your cash out is worth about $300.

*Life Leave allows team members to use their holidays as it’s meant to be – a break – whilst knowing they’ve got the breathing space to tap into extra leave for the planned and unplanned life moments.

Paid holidays

  • You have 7 paid US holidays.

Additional benefits

  • Bereavement Policy

  • Employee Giving Programs (Matching Gift Program, Volunteer Grant Program, etc)

  • Bereavement Policy

  • Employee Giving Programs (Matching Gift Program, Volunteer Grant Program, etc)
